meanings.definition: The act of eating a meal that combines breakfast and lunch.
meanings.sent1: We enjoyed a delicious brunching at the new cafe.
meanings.sent2: On Sundays, many people like to go out for brunching.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to go brunching to celebrate the special occasion.
meanings.sent4: Her brunching was a delightful mix of pancakes and sandwiches.
meanings.sent5: The brunching spread was so tempting, it was hard to choose what to eat.

meanings.definition: To engage in the activity of having a late morning meal.
meanings.sent1: She was brunching with her friends at the trendy spot.
meanings.sent2: They were brunching together after a long morning of work.
meanings.sent3: Brunching on a weekday felt like a luxury.
meanings.sent4: He was brunching like a king with all the delicious options.
meanings.sent5: Brunching by the window, she watched the world go by outside.
